body:
Could you please confirm the line ending if you use the PowerShell (https://github.com/puckel/docker-airflow/issues/204#issuecomment-402410556).

If it is the cause, you can avoid it by [git setting](https://git-scm.com/book/it/v2/Customizing-Git-Git-Configuration).

i'm still having this issue
Windows 10 Pro
Python

`(t-nlp-env) c:\Users\FVRODRIGUES\GIT>git clone https://github.com/doccano/doccano.git --config core.autocrlf=input

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/87960/74733564-54eb4e80-522b-11ea-8ffc-a5d080a77778.png)

@dentvii Please read `Note for Windows developers`. It is caused by line breaks in the bash file.

https://github.com/doccano/doccano#docker-compose

Sorry,  didn’t understand as I have used the git config aas shown in the image
`git clone https://github.com/doccano/doccano.git --config core.autocrlf=input `
Yet the results are the same. Is there anything else I am missing?
The bash files in your cloned repository will contain `crlf` line breaks. Please replace these to `lf`.

Manually changed all CRLF to LF from all SH files within doccano folder, yet yielded the same results

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/87960/74846571-6e65c680-530f-11ea-934c-a3d91c32e520.png)

Even when changing every single file (JSON, YML, PY) the same happens.
Would you please delete images that built from docker-compose not only containers? Your images will already be built with `crlf` bash files.

@icoxfog417 made it!

For Windows Users:

1. Update GIT ([Download new version here](https://git-scm.com/download/win))
2. Open terminal
3. Type  `git --version`
4. Check if the version matches
5. Create a new folder
6. Use the following command `git clone https://github.com/doccano/doccano.git --config core.autocrlf=input`
7. After the download, open Notepad++ ([downloadable here](https://notepad-plus-plus.org/downloads/)) on split screen
8. Within Notepad++, on the menu click on View, Show Symbol, then Enable Show End of Line
9. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/87960/75084710-abdd7600-5500-11ea-8931-705ad408987a.png)
10. Now within the folder of the Git type on the search bar *.sh
11. Select all of these files and drop them inside Notepad++
12. If you see this, the core.autocrlf=input failed
13. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/87960/75084751-0d054980-5501-11ea-8e2a-5aec3e343274.png)
14. If it failed, go back to the folder search and select all files (yml, py, sh) and drop them in NotePad++
15. Now use the shortcut CTRL+H and type the following, with attention to the options
16. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/87960/75084784-5e153d80-5501-11ea-8597-a66f131b2844.png)
17. Save all files 
18. If you finished this or if you didn't have any problem at all with CR LF,  now go inside the folder created by the git command
19. Now use the folllowing command `docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml up`

It will take a long time, but it should now build.
You will not seem it working 0.0.0.0, but rather localhost:80/

IF you have tried to build before without the error, you will have to clear the docker images.
To do so, stop all containers (I'll assume you don't have any competing dockers)

1. Use the command `docker container ls` to see all the containers 
2. Now use the command `docker container stop ` followed by the copied and paste of all the rows in the column CONTAINER_ID
3. Clear the containers with `docker system prune`
4. List all images with `docker images`
5. Now use the comand `docker rmi --force ` followed by the copy and paste of all the rows in IMAGE_ID (if they don't delete, you may try again as the order is important)
6. It is useful to restart the Docker on Windows (use the GUI) or if you can't find it just restart windows itself.
7. Now go back to the guide above

thanks folks. btw i had this error too and cloning using:
`git clone https://github.com/doccano/doccano.git --config core.autocrlf=false`
...fixed the issue and allowed docker compose to work

issue.title: Things seem to be running fine on the backend, but then I try to run 'http://0.0.0.0:8000', it says unable to connect

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
> How to reproduce the behaviour
![Screenshot (311)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28100084/87068845-cf952480-c233-11ea-9902-e6fcbebfa4ec.png)

![Screenshot (310)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28100084/87068870-da4fb980-c233-11ea-9659-83b876b223ac.png)

---------
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

<!--
Include a code example or the steps that led to the problem. Please try to be as specific as possible. -->

Your Environment
---------

<!-- Include details of your environment. -->

*   Operating System: Windows10
*   Python Version Used: 3.6
*   When you install doccano: git clone https://github.com/doccano/doccano.git --config core.autocrlf=input
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml up
